74#define TARGET_MAJOR 0

87#define EE_MAX_CPU 64
88/* Flag: BMDEBUG
89 * Set BMDEBUG to a (1) to enable debugging printf's in benchmarks
90 * Set it to a (0) for the released version of the BM
91 */
92#if !defined( BMDEBUG )
93#define BMDEBUG (0)
94#endif
95
96/* Flag: THDEBUG
97 * Set THDEBUG to a (1) to enable debugging printf's in the harness
98 * Set it to a (0) for the released version of the BM
99 */
100#if !defined( THDEBUG )
101#define THDEBUG (0)
102#endif
103/* Flag: EE_BIG_ENDIAN
104 * Define BIG or LITTLE Endian here.
105 * @note If not defined from COMPILER_DEFINES in toolchain file, Set it here.
106 * Default is Little Endian.
107 */
108#if !defined( EE_BIG_ENDIAN ) && !defined( EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
109#define EE_BIG_ENDIAN 0
110#define EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN 1
111#endif
112
113#if !defined( EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN )
114#define EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN (!EE_BIG_ENDIAN)
115#endif
116
117#if !defined( EE_BIG_ENDIAN )
118#define EE_BIG_ENDIAN (!EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN)
119#endif
120
121#if EE_BIG_ENDIAN && EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN
122#error "Cannot have both Big and Little Endian 1"
123#endif
124
125#if ((!EE_BIG_ENDIAN) && (!EE_LITTLE_ENDIAN))
126#error "Cannot have both Big and Little Endian 0"
127#endif
128
129/* Flag: EE_SIZEOF_PTR
130 Define number of bytes for pointer type.
131 Default to 4 bytes.
132*/
133#if !defined(EE_SIZEOF_PTR)
134#define EE_SIZEOF_PTR 4
135#define EE_PTR_ALIGN 4
136#endif
137
138/* Flag: EE_SIZEOF_LONG
139 Define number of bytes for long type.
140 Default to 4 bytes.
141*/
142#if !defined(EE_SIZEOF_LONG)
143#define EE_SIZEOF_LONG 4
144#endif
145
146/* Flag: EE_SIZEOF_INT
147 Define number of bytes for int type.
148 Default to 4 bytes.
149*/
150#if !defined(EE_SIZEOF_INT)
151#define EE_SIZEOF_INT 4
152#endif
153
154/* Flag: NEED_INT_LIMITS
155 Define this if you need INT_MIN and INT_MAX
156 and they are not provided by your compiler header files.
157*/
158#if !defined(NEED_INT_LIMITS)
159#define NEED_INT_LIMITS 0
160#endif

205/* define NO_RESTRICT_QUALIFIER if compiler does not support restrict */
206#if !defined( RESTRICT )
207#if !defined( NO_RESTRICT_QUALIFIER )
208#if _MSC_VER
209#define RESTRICT __restrict
210#else
211#define RESTRICT restrict
212#endif
213#else
214#define RESTRICT
215#endif
216#endif
217
218/* default alignment for fp data array */
219#if !defined(ALIGN_BOUNDARY)
220#define ALIGN_BOUNDARY 8
221#endif
222
223//We don't need this
224#define NO_VAR_ALIGN
225/* define NO_VAR_ALIGN to avoid variable array alignment */
226#if !defined ( NO_VAR_ALIGN )
227 #if _MSC_VER
228 #define __ALIGN_PRE(x) __declspec(align(x))
229 #define __ALIGN_POST(x)
230 #else
231 #define __ALIGN_PRE(x)
232 #define __ALIGN_POST(x) __attribute__ ((aligned (x)))
233 #endif
234#else
235 #define __ALIGN_PRE(x)
236 #define __ALIGN_POST(x)
237#endif
238
239#define _ALIGN_VAR(type, var) __ALIGN_PRE(ALIGN_BOUNDARY) type var __ALIGN_POST(ALIGN_BOUNDARY)
240
241//We don't need this because the memory management APIs in freertos is aligned to 8, witch is same as the ALIGN_BOUNDARY
242#define NO_ALIGNED_ALLOC
243
244#if defined(AM_BAREMETAL)
245
246#if defined( NO_ALIGNED_ALLOC )
247#define malloc_aligned(size, align) malloc(size)
248#define free_aligned(base) free(base)
249#else
250#if _MSC_VER
251#define malloc_aligned(size, align) _aligned_malloc(size, align)
252#define free_aligned(base) _aligned_free(base)
253#else
254#define malloc_aligned(size, align) ({void *p; (posix_memalign(&p, align, size) == 0) ? p : NULL;})
255#define free_aligned(base) free(base)
256#endif
257#endif
258
259#endif
260
277#if !defined (COMPILE_OUT_HEAP)
278#define COMPILE_OUT_HEAP (1)
279#endif
281#if !defined (HAVE_MALLOC)
282#define HAVE_MALLOC (1)
283#endif
284
285#if !HAVE_MALLOC
286#error "This version of the test harness does not have internal heap management"
287#endif
289#if !COMPILE_OUT_HEAP && HAVE_MALLOC
290#error "COMPILE_OUT_HEAP is 0, and HAVE_MALLOC is 1. Cannot select both internal and compiler malloc functions."
291#endif

681/* Thread related configuration */

686//Note: The stack size is in unit of word, and should not exceed 64K.
687#define PTHREAD_DEFAULT_STACK_SIZE (1*1024)
688//This stack size is only for parser_125k workload, it uses recursive functions
689#define PTHREAD_BIG_STACK_SIZE (32*1024)
690#define PTHREAD_DEFAULT_PRIORITY (4)
691
692#ifndef USE_NATIVE_PTHREAD
693#define USE_NATIVE_PTHREAD 0
694#endif
695#ifndef MAX_CONTEXTS
696#define MAX_CONTEXTS 1
697#endif

699#define HAVE_PTHREAD_SETAFFINITY_NP 0
700#endif

702#define HAVE_PTHREAD_SELF 0
703#endif
704#ifndef USE_SINGLE_CONTEXT

706#define USE_SINGLE_CONTEXT 1
707#else
708#define USE_SINGLE_CONTEXT 0
709#endif
710#endif
711#if USE_SINGLE_CONTEXT
712#define MAX_CONTEXTS 1
713#undef HAVE_PTHREAD
714#define HAVE_PTHREAD 0
715#undef USE_NATIVE_PTHREAD
716#define USE_NATIVE_PTHREAD 0
717#endif
